discussion.p: During code review of elements_view for MSVC-STL we found two issues that should be easily addressed:

li.p: elements_view::iterator constraints both operator++(int) member functions

blockquote.pre: constexpr void operator++(int) requires (!forward_range<Base>); constexpr iterator operator++(int) requires forward_range<Base>;

li.p: However, given that a constrained method would be preferred we only need to constrain one of those. The proposal would be to remove the constraint from the void returning overload and change the declaration to

blockquote.pre: constexpr void operator++(int); constexpr iterator operator++(int) requires forward_range<Base>;

li.p: elements_view::iterator operator- is constrained as follows:

blockquote.pre: friend constexpr difference_type operator-(const iterator& x, const iterator& y) requires random_access_range<Base>;

li.p: However, that requires its base to have operator- defined. We should change the constraint to sized_sentinel_for<iterator_t<Base>, iterator_t<Base>>:

blockquote.pre: friend constexpr difference_type operator-(const iterator& x, const iterator& y) requires sized_sentinel_for<iterator_t<Base>, iterator_t<Base>>;

discussion.p: Bullet (2) of the discussion has already been resolved by LWG , it has therefore been omitted from the proposed wording below.
Set priority to 0 and status to Tentatively Ready after five votes in favour during reflector discussions.
